required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety And PK Study Of CVX-060 In Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multicenter, Open-label, Dose-escalation, Safety, Pharmacokinetic, And Pharmacodynamic Trial Of Cvx-060, A Selective Angiopoietin-2 (Ang-2) Binding, Anti-angiogenic Covx-body, In Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and tolerability of CVX-060 in patients with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Treatment-Related Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) up to 30 days after last dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-related AE was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to study drug in a participant who received study drug. Serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 30 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state. Relatedness to CVX-060 was assessed by the investigator (Yes/No). Participants with multiple occurrences of an AE within a category were counted once within the category.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Serum decay half-life is the time measured for the serum concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 168 Hours [AUC (0-168)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC (0-168)= Area under the serum concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to 168 hours after dosing (Day 7).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution after intravenous infusion dose (Vss) is influenced by the fraction absorbed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood (rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes). Clearance obtained after intravenous infusion dose (apparent clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hour (pre-dose) on Day 0 up to Day 7 of cycle 1 (28 days cycle)
Baseline (Day 0) up to 42 days after the last dose of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: RP2D was determined as the highest dose where none out of 3 (0/3) or less than or equal to 1 out of 6 (<=1/6) participants experienced a dose limiting toxicity (DLT) or was determined based on the safety, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic findings. DLT was first course AE defined based on National Cancer Institute common toxicity criteria for adverse events version 3 (NCI-CTCAE Version 3) as any hematologic or non-hematologic toxicity greater than or equal to (>=) Grade 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-CVX-060 Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) up to 42 days after last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Samples From Participants With Anti-CVX-060 Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) up to 42 days after last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (predose), assessed every 8 weeks (2 cycles) until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal for other reasons (up to Week 133)
secondary_outcome.description: BOR: best response recorded from treatment start until disease progression/recurrence based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all lesions. Partial Response (PR): >=30% decrease in sum of longest diameters (SLDs) of target lesions taking as reference baseline SLDs, associated to non-progressive disease (non-PD) response for non-target (NT) lesions. PD: >=20% increase in SLDs of target lesions taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start, or appearance of >=1 new lesion, or unequivocal progression in NT lesions. Stable disease (SD): neither shrinkage for CR/PR nor increase for PD taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start. CR and PR had to be confirmed on a follow up imaging assessment >=4 weeks after initial objective documentation of response. SD criteria should be met at least once after start of treatment in a minimum interval of 8 weeks. Participants with >=3 treatments cycles were reported.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed advanced solid tumors unresponsive to currently available therapies or for which there is no standard therapy.
- Adequate coagulation, liver, and renal function.
- Candidate for DCE-MRI evaluations.
- ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status of 0 or 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of significant bleeding problems.
- History of certain gastrointestinal problems including fistula and abscess.
- Chronic, uncontrolled hypertension.
- Patients with any history of primary or metastatic tumor involvement of the brain or with tumors that encase great vessels.

group.title: CVX-060 0.3 mg/kg (Stage 1)
group.description: CVX-060 0.3 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) of body weight intravenous infusion administered once-weekly in a 4-week cycle in dose escalation stage (Stage 1).

baseline.population: Safety population included all enrolled participants in the study who received any study medication.

group.title: CVX-060 (Stage 1 and 2)
group.description: CVX-060 0.3, 1, 3, 6, 12, 15 mg/kg of body weight intravenous infusion in Stage 1 and CVX-060 15 mg/kg of body weight intravenous infusion in Stage 2, administered once-weekly in a 4-week cycle.

measure.title: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Tmax)
measure.population: PK analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of CVX-060 and had PK data.

outcome.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D): Stage 1
outcome.description: RP2D was determined as the highest dose where none out of 3 (0/3) or less than or equal to 1 out of 6 (<=1/6) participants experienced a dose limiting toxicity (DLT) or was determined based on the safety, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic findings. DLT was first course AE defined based on National Cancer Institute common toxicity criteria for adverse events version 3 (NCI-CTCAE Version 3) as any hematologic or non-hematologic toxicity greater than or equal to (>=) Grade 3.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) up to 42 days after the last dose of study medication
outcome.population: Safety population included all enrolled participants in the study who received any study medication.

group.title: CVX-060 (Stage 1)
group.description: All participants who received 0.3, 1, 3, 6, 12, 15 mg/kg intravenous infusion once-weekly in Stage 1. Participants who discontinued treatment at any time were followed for 6 weeks to assess toxicity, pharmacokinetics (elimination half-life), and immunogenicity.

measure.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D): Stage 1
measure.description: RP2D was determined as the highest dose where none out of 3 (0/3) or less than or equal to 1 out of 6 (<=1/6) participants experienced a dose limiting toxicity (DLT) or was determined based on the safety, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamic findings. DLT was first course AE defined based on National Cancer Institute common toxicity criteria for adverse events version 3 (NCI-CTCAE Version 3) as any hematologic or non-hematologic toxicity greater than or equal to (>=) Grade 3.
measure.population: Safety population included all enrolled participants in the study who received any study medication.

measure.title: Number of Samples From Participants With Anti-CVX-060 Antibodies
measure.population: Anti-drug antibodies (ADA) analysis set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of CVX-060 and had PK data.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR)
outcome.description: BOR: best response recorded from treatment start until disease progression/recurrence based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all lesions. Partial Response (PR): >=30% decrease in sum of longest diameters (SLDs) of target lesions taking as reference baseline SLDs, associated to non-progressive disease (non-PD) response for non-target (NT) lesions. PD: >=20% increase in SLDs of target lesions taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start, or appearance of >=1 new lesion, or unequivocal progression in NT lesions. Stable disease (SD): neither shrinkage for CR/PR nor increase for PD taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start. CR and PR had to be confirmed on a follow up imaging assessment >=4 weeks after initial objective documentation of response. SD criteria should be met at least once after start of treatment in a minimum interval of 8 weeks. Participants with >=3 treatments cycles were reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (predose), assessed every 8 weeks (2 cycles) until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal for other reasons (up to Week 133)
outcome.population: Safety population included all enrolled participants in the study who received any study medication.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR)
measure.description: BOR: best response recorded from treatment start until disease progression/recurrence based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Complete Response (CR): disappearance of all lesions. Partial Response (PR): >=30% decrease in sum of longest diameters (SLDs) of target lesions taking as reference baseline SLDs, associated to non-progressive disease (non-PD) response for non-target (NT) lesions. PD: >=20% increase in SLDs of target lesions taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start, or appearance of >=1 new lesion, or unequivocal progression in NT lesions. Stable disease (SD): neither shrinkage for CR/PR nor increase for PD taking as reference smallest SLDs since treatment start. CR and PR had to be confirmed on a follow up imaging assessment >=4 weeks after initial objective documentation of response. SD criteria should be met at least once after start of treatment in a minimum interval of 8 weeks. Participants with >=3 treatments cycles were reported.
measure.population: Safety population included all enrolled participants in the study who received any study medication.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: CVX-060 0.3 mg/kg (Stage 1)
group.description: CVX-060 0.3 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) of body weight intravenous infusion administered once-weekly in a 4-week cycle in dose escalation stage (Stage 1).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Designation of outcomes as primary, secondary was based on study team’s input as study did not specify them as primary or secondary.
